unnormalised: **Entertainment News: Bollywood's Box Office Biryani – Who's Got the Most Spice?**
normalised: **Entertainment News: Bollywood's Box Office Biryani – Who's Got the Most Spice?**

unnormalised: Mumbai: Bollywood's churning out movies faster than your aunty can make biryani for Onam! This week saw 3 big releases, all vying for your hard-earned Rs. 300.
normalised: Mumbai: Bollywood's churning out movies faster than your aunty can make biryani for Onam! This week saw three big releases, all vying for your hard-earned rupee three hundred.

unnormalised: "Prem Ki Pathology," a romantic comedy starring Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor (again!), promises more family drama than your average Delhi wedding. Critics are calling it "predictable but palatable," like that same paneer dish you always order.
normalised: "Prem Ki Pathology," a romantic comedy starring Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor (again!), promises more family drama than your average Delhi wedding. Critics are calling it "predictable but palatable," like that same paneer dish you always order.

unnormalised: Then there's "Dhoom 5: Desi Drift," featuring a new generation of bike-riding baddies tearing through the streets of Bangalore at a cool 200 km/hr. Expect gravity-defying stunts and dialogues that'll make your head spin faster than a top.
normalised: Then there's "Dhoom five: Desi Drift," featuring a new generation of bike-riding baddies tearing through the streets of Bangalore at a cool two hundred kilometer per hour. Expect gravity-defying stunts and dialogues that'll make your head spin faster than a top.

unnormalised: But the dark horse? "Professor Chakravarty's Case Files," a mystery thriller filmed entirely in a dimly lit Kolkata mansion. Early buzz suggests a gripping plot, though some are complaining about the excessive use of Rabindra Sangeet.
normalised: But the dark horse? "Professor Chakravarty's Case Files," a mystery thriller filmed entirely in a dimly lit Kolkata mansion. Early buzz suggests a gripping plot, though some are complaining about the excessive use of Rabindra Sangeet.

unnormalised: Will the biryani be spicy enough to draw in the crowds? Stay tuned for the box office report!
normalised: Will the biryani be spicy enough to draw in the crowds? Stay tuned for the box office report!
